title: Why am I not allowed to have an opinion because of my rank?
body:
Straight to the point there are so many people that just flat out shoot anything anyone says down if they rank is less than gold. No matter what it is, its validity is only measured by the rank of who it comes from even if it has valid points that can be considered from person experiences and personal takes on them. I am going to say this outright hurts my feelings. I want to feel like i am a welcomed part of the community and it people can hear other people out. But instead nobody cares about other people because of their rank--doesn't matter what kind of person they are, what they say, what they think, how they play for certain.

* A challenger player can say the sky is blue and people will nod and agree because their rank is high. Not because of what they said, but because they said it with a high rank.

* A silver or lower player can say the sky is blue and will be degraded for being silver or lower ranked. They can make their point politely, amicably, but that doesnt matter because of their rank. Not because of what they said, but because they said it with a low rank.

This genuinely makes me sad as someone that comes here to be a part of the community, and is made to feel completely unwelcome because I dont have time to play to raise my rank--i dont have TIME for it, nor do i enjoy playing for it. I'd like to think i am a nice person that people would get along with (granted they arent being dicks, i still am human), but that doesnt matter to people because of my rank. I could have a bad game and be dogged for deserving it because of my rank (in an UNRANKED game no less). I could have a good game where i deserved to win, and i will be dogged for being lucky because of my rank. I am overlooked scoffed at and treated like a pariah because of my rank. People look at my rank first and judge my entire character as my rank. That is terrible. That is a terrible thing to do.

*My Rank in a video game is not my worth as a human being.* Being bronze doesnt mean i dont have feelings. Being bronze doesn't mean im worthless. There is a human being behind this moniter and when you tell her shes worthless, her opinions don't matter just because of an arbitrary rank it HURTS her feelings. 

Why must i be a professional just to be a part of the league of legends community? Why can i not have anything i think or say be considered because im a lowly bronze? Why do i have to appease people to feel good and be treated with respect when i've done nothing to deserve such disrespect and discrimination other than be bronze? Im not allowed to talk about ANYTHING because im low ranked? 

I have spent 7 long grueling years with this game, i have sat through a total of 101 ryze reworks, Rally summoner spell, "Singed's Best Friend", Soraka jungle, before there actually WAS a jungle, Pizza feet, Katarina's original voice (dear god), Tons of damage, Krepo when he was an ADC, Bjeregsen when he played with Deficio before even coming to america, Reginald when he was a Top laner, Blitzcrank when he was a top lane pick, voyboy being voyboy, Shaco mid, Master yi mid (in season 2 long before faker made it cool), when you could stay permanently invisible as Shaco with a sunfire cape, Atma's impaler, Deathfire grasp, Zhonya's ring, 100% ban kassadin, spirit of the elder lizard/ancient golem being a rush item on LANERS, and much much more. I have experience with the game, but in those 7 years i just simply dont care to play for rank, and i recently only davvle with it from time to time just to get a rank because i enjoy more serious games sometimes, but not caring to climb in and out of them.

This will probably be ignored, overlooked, this is an unpopular opinion that nobody will care about because im not platinum at least. But i wanted to get it off my chest. Im sure others have been told things like this. How can people feel good about themselves for being discriminatory?

The reason why people automatically dismiss a bronze player's opinion is the same reason why people tend to trust the opinion of experts even when the subject is completely outside of their expertise. Humans like to simplify things into very simple patterns, and thus there are only two kinds of players: Good players, whose opinion can be trusted blindly, and bad players, who are never right.
And the most funny of it all: Everybody has their own threshold as to who is considered bad/good and why. So somebody who dismisses your opinion because your bronze, might have their opinion dismissed by somebody who's even more elitist, or simply has different metric by which they judge a player.

Relevant Shakespeare quote:
"The more pity that fools may not speak wisely what wisemen do foolishly."

Edit: That said, the only, and I mean **only** excusable argument that features somebody's rank, is when somebody is making a **general** argument based on **personal** experience, since that can actually be the result of a skewed point of view. But honestly, that goes both ways. A diamond player might not be able to grasp why a certain champion is so frustrating to play against in low Elo, that the champion needs an overhaul.

Not to be nitpicky but:

> people tend to trust the opinion of experts even when the subject is completely outside of their expertise.

I went back and read your post. Everything in my post still applies. It has nothing to do with you personally or your feelings. It has nothing to do with you as a human being. It has to do with the fact that at your rank you do not know enough about the game for your opinion on game balance to hold any weight. 

Imagine if someone just moved to America and had no idea what football was prior to coming. Now this person thinks they have valid points on how football should be played, but in reality all they are seeing is a bunch of guys throwing a ball around, they don't understand all the ins and outs, they don't understand how each position (role) is played, they do not know why they are doing certain runs with certain players (champions) but not with others, they do not even notice these things or have any clue that these things exist. 

Now that person wants to play football and plays in a very casual way, where him and his friends, all new to the sport, with no prior knowledge,, in order to learn off each other. None of them actually know the game, so really none of them are capable of teaching each other the game. Now after playing together for a year they think they are pretty good, even though they do things that make absolutely no sense when you consider how real football is played because they simply do not know better. Now that they think they know the game they apply for careers in the sport. Some want to be coaches, some want to be a referee, umpire, head linesman, line judge, back judge, side judge, center judge or field judge. They do not even know what these titles actually mean, they just watched enough professional games to know these things exist and they think from playing with their friends in their backyard that they have knowledge that is in some what comparable.

How do you think it is going to go for any of them when they put in an application? Are their feelings going to be saved and they are going to be coddled and told they are good enough for the job and just given a chance? Are they going to be told they are pretty good, but just a tad off from the mark? No, this is the real world, they are going to be told they barely earned the title of amateur and to get lost.

This is why people don't listen to or take the advice of low elo players seriously when they talk about anything balance related which takes game knowledge. Watching a bronze/silver/gold game is pretty similar to watching people that just moved to America try to play football when they come from a country where football did not exist. Even if they were a pro baseball player and an athlete from their country, not enough of the skills will carry over to make them worth a shit in football. 

You mentioned that you do not have the time to climb in ranked. If you think it takes long to climb out of bronze, silver, or gold then you do not know the game very well. With casual playing I can get an account from unranked to plat if I actually try harded it. By putting in absolutely no effort I can get an account into gold 5. I can legit watch a movie on my second monitor, missing out on what would normally be vital map awareness type of information, and it would not matter one bit, because the other players that are actually focused on the game aren't focused on the right things. 

People make all these cry baby posts about their  feelings, and that is what it is, a cry baby post, but they do not take a second to look at it from the perspective of the players that actually play this game competitively and have consistently been around the top 1% of the population. We know the game and we all have smurfs. None of us play in bronze/silver/gold and think "Damn, these guys are pretty good, I wonder what is different between them and people on my main." We legit shit stomp the games and laugh pretty uncontrollably about how much fun it is to smurf because it is like playing vs an easier version of beginner bots since there is so much human error it is ridiculous. 

I see build paths that make no sense, I see people making judgment calls that make me wonder if they have ever actually carried a game, I see no real play set ups at all. All I see is people that make mistakes and other people that occasionally pick up kills off the other player's mistake. I see people that get handed free kills because they are playing vs someone that is pretty much first timing a champion (when really they have like 50 games on that champion, but still haven't grasped the concept), yet even with all the free kills they get they are unable to carry because they do not farm correctly, rotate correctly, pressure the right lanes at the right time, go for objectives, challenge objectives, roam, etc. I see so many mistakes in low elo I am not surprised at all that those players are in Bronze/Silver/Gold. 

So while you may think you are entitled to an opinion because you are a human, you have to realize that this game is a science and it is a science that you do not comprehend. If you did comprehend it your normals MMR after around 900 games wouldn't be around Bronze 1 and your rank on your 4th season of playing the game wouldn't also still be around high bronze / low silver.

You may think it takes hundreds or thousands of games to hit a certain rank, but I can assure you it does not. Anyone can hit Gold 5 by just playing completely casually and pushing to Plat 5 just takes having basic game knowledge. If you think differently then I am telling you right now that you are wrong. I am not telling you  this with 100% certainty just because I've been Diamond for the last 3 years consecutively, I'm telling you this because I have experience climbing the ladder. I have climbed the ladder multiple times on multiple accounts, Every Single Season that I've played ranked. I know what Bronze to Diamond has been all about for the last 3 years. Some people try to say "Oh but this season it is so much harder to climb through Silver compared to last season!" They say this because last season they barely got to Gold 5 and now they are stuck in low Silver. This is because the game evolves and those that haven't grasped it yet are thrown completely off balance when the game changes while those that already fully grasp how to play the game are able to quickly adapt. This is why high elo pretty much consistently stays in high elo.

It has literally nothing to do with you as a person. It has to do with the fact that you are making judgment calls while completely lacking the knowledge and experience to have any sort of authority. It is nice that you want to be a part of the community. We welcome you more than you think, but you have to earn your spot if you want to start throwing around your opinion on what is balanced or broken, because the simple truth is that right now you do not know. Your experience in this game is very limited and if they balanced this game based off what goes on in low elo then people that actually knew how to play this game would be stuck playing **Clown Fiesta Simulator**.
